Key Arguments: The government already has means to address genuine threats without this legislation.
The bill is poorly drafted with vague definitions of key terms like misinformation, disinformation, and harm.
The legislation could be weaponized against dissenting views and contravenes human rights treaties.
The bill represents a move towards totalitarianism by attempting to control speech and information.
Notable Quotes: The remedy to be applied [to falsehood and fallacies] is more speech, not enforced silence.
Such a government has already taken the first dangerous steps on the road to totalitarianism.
The draft Bill directly contravenes the right to freedom of expression.
